story.headline: China's Coal Heartland Is a Global Super-Emitter
story.summary: Shanxi Province is China's largest coal-producing region and one of the world's most concentrated sources of greenhouse gas emissions. Sentinel-5P satellite data has identified persistent CO₂ and methane plumes over the region.
story.climateImpact: Coal mining and combustion from Shanxi release massive quantities of CO₂ and methane, making this single province a top global emissions contributor.
causeEffect: Shanxi produces over 1 billion tons of coal annually
Coal combustion releases CO₂ at industrial scale
Coal seam methane venting adds a potent greenhouse gas
Coal-fired power plants supply much of northern China's energy
Local air pollution causes severe health impacts
story.scaleContext: Shanxi alone accounts for roughly 25% of China's coal production. China produces and consumes over half the world's coal. The province's emissions rival those of many entire countries.
story.outlook: China has pledged carbon neutrality by 2060, but coal production in Shanxi continues to expand in the short term to meet energy security demands.

title: China's Coal Heartland Is a Global Super-Emitter
summary: Shanxi Province produces over 1 billion tons of coal annually, making it one of the world's most concentrated greenhouse gas emission sources.
